subject: p10268877
History: Intubated patient with multiple arrests and now being treated for pneumonia.
Findings: Comparison is made with prior study performed a day earlier. There are low lung volumes. ET tube is in the standard position. NG tube tip is out of view below the diaphragm. A right PICC tip is in the right atrium, unchanged. Cardiomegaly is stable. Mild pulmonary edema and bibasilar consolidations, larger on the left side, are grossly unchanged. If any, there is a small left pleural effusion.
